source.name: Final critical Habitat for 41 Plant Species from the island of Molokai, HI
source.description: Abstract: These data identify, in general, the areas where final critical habitat occurs for 41 listed plant species known historically from the island of Molokai. A total of approximately 9,843 hectares (24,333 acres) of land on Molokai fall within the boundaries of the 88 critical habitat units designated for these 41 species. Purpose: Critical habitat are areas considered essential for the conservation of a listed species. These areas provide notice to the public and land managers the importance of these areas to the conservation of this species. Special protections and/or restrictions are possible in areas where federal funding, permits, licenses, authorizations, or actions occur or are required.
